name: Bay Area Legal Aid (BayLegal)
description: Free civil legal services in housing, benefits, healthcare, consumer, and family law for low-income Bay Area residents
fullDescription: Bay Area Legal Aid is the largest civil legal aid provider in the Bay Area, offering free legal help to low-income individuals in housing, public benefits, healthcare, consumer, and family law matters.
whatTheyOffer:
- Housing law (eviction defense, habitability, Section 8)
- Public benefits (CalFresh, Medi-Cal, CalWORKs appeals)
- Healthcare access and insurance issues
- Consumer rights and debt issues
- Domestic violence restraining orders
- Immigration assistance
- Senior law services
howToGetIt:
1. Call the intake line at 800-551-5554
2. Or apply online at baylegal.org
3. Must meet income eligibility (generally 200% FPL or below)
4. Complete phone or online intake
5. If eligible, receive legal advice, brief services, or representation
keywords: BayLegal, Bay Area Legal Aid, free lawyer, legal aid, eviction, housing, public benefits, healthcare, domestic violence, consumer, low-income, civil legal
